My muscles burned as though I had been doing an extremely strenuous workout for hours.  I had to take 800 mg of Advil every 5-6 hours to even function.  The pain only mostly subsided after I had been off the Amlodipine for 10 days, but my BP was extremely high and I took the pill again and within 3 days I was in extreme pain.

After repeated bp systolic readings over 200, I was started on this med in December 2013, and am still on it. I have also been on 2 other classes of blood pressure meds for years. All bp meds are at maximum dosage at present. I also have had a diagnosis of chronic pain syndrome with associated osteoarthritis in numerous locations AND fibromyalgia; that was diagnoses in 2000. As of now, my systolic bp is still high with frequent readings in the 170's.

What I specifically want to address is that the side effects of this medication has had a devastating effect on my carefully balanced pain management.   The swelling of the hands and feet has brought on almost constant pain in my wrists and hands.  Sleep is always an issue with fibromyalgia, and this drug only adds to those issues; I also certainly did not need help with my depression.  I am so tired and in so much pain.  After appointments with my family practitioner and my rheumatologist this week, they are working together to on how to satisfactorily manage both my bp and my pain level.  I think this drug needs some careful study on its interactions in patients diagnosed with chronic pain syndrome.

I have been on this drug since February 2013 - side effects: feet and ankles so swollen cant tie shoes.  hurts to walk.  also gained about 10 pounds.  all my joints hurt when I get out of bed in the morning.  have discontinued this med and dr will prescribe something else.

After extremely high blood pressure, the cardiologist prescribed amlodopine.  I take the generic.  I have taken it for about 2 yrs.6 months into it, my thyroid started becoming irregular and I had heart palpitations. We tried adjusting the thyroid meds, but I kept getting heart palpitations even though the thyroid was running low.    After over a year of trying different meds for thyroid, I asked to be taken off the amlodopine since I read it can affect thyroid.  The good news is that I have not had a single heart palpitation since I stopped this med.  My bp is back to being high again, but hopefully the dr will prescribe something else other than this horrible medication.   By the way, I had no swelling, never realized the meds were causing the heart palpitations....I was blaming the thyroid medication.  I am glad I am off this.

Have used for @ 2 years. Leg swelling progressively worsening; unsteadiness on feet; cognitive confusion. Last 2-3 months, extreme fatigue, SOB, extreme leg swelling to point I couldn't get shoes on. I have severe rheumatic-like swelling in one joint on one hand; general joint and muscle pains; increased SOB.  Two relatives of my age group also taking this drug. I plan to submit an FDA report on the severe side effects from this medication.  I would not recommend anyone take this drug.

It has assisted in reducing my hypertension. However, I have to manage the dosage to reduce side effects especially swelling of the ankles.  Not a pleasant medication for long term usage.

not only did it not reduce my BP significantly but it produced a violent allergic facial skin condition ,first itching and red rash ,then hives [lumps ] and finally swelling all over my face resulting in a visit to A & E 
and 4 weeks on steroids and many weeks of misery .
There is a reference to this side effect being "very rare"
but I wonder how rare it really is --manufacturers rely 
on patients to report side effects , but when they are as extreme as this many people would wish to have nothing 
more to do with the drug  or its maker -that is my reaction . The main problem with an allergic reaction of this sort is that it it is not immediately apparent what is causing it  ,particularly if you are taking other drugs . Also there are many other substances that can cause allergic 
reactions and even a consultant dermatologist may not look at a mainstream drug as an obvious candidate when
there be any number of environmental or food factors 
involved .Only by a long and exhaustive elimination process was amlodipine identified as the villain in my 
case --stopping taking it while continuing the steroids 
cured it completely ,but as soon as I started again [still taking the steroids ] back it came and the steroids could do nothing to stop it . I think more research needs to be done on this --the swelling and hives if they progress inwards around the face can lead to serious complications.

I have been taking it for 5-10 years. At first, it caused ankle swelling. That went away with time. It still causes some fatigue. But BP went from 150/100 to 120/70. I took amlodipine for nearly two years.   My legs were perpetually swollen and felt uncomfortable as well as looking unsightly.   My blood pressure seemed normal, but one day I thought of putting the cuff on my legs and the pressure was very different -- over 220.   I asked my doctor (who had been unwilling to switch drugs) if it was really a good idea to have good pressure in my arms and highly elevated pressure in my legs.   I now take Losartan:  no side effects, good blood pressure control.   I strongly suggest that anyone suffering any swelling in their legs when taking Amlodipine should check the pressure in all limbs.   Legs can be higher, but not double.

I started Bystolic after visiting my doctor after a car accident. I was initally put on 5mg. On my follow up apt a month later, my bp was still too high, so my dose was increased to 10mg. I mentioned to my dr that since beginning this drug i have had a real problem with insomnia. I was told that it was not the drug, that instead it was stress and anxiety. I never had problems sleeping before i started Bystolic. Has anyone else had problems with insomnia after starting?

I start taking Bystolic, 5mg, 9/10 - being switched from 2.5mg Lisinopril which I’ve been on for 3 months - worked great, but, came down with a dreadful case of Psoriasis that I’ve never had before, nor is there any family history. Dermatologist thinks it “may” be the Lisinopril – cardiologist doesn’t think so, but, suggested I try Bystolic. After reading the comments, might just try “spin the drug wheel” again.

I have been on 5mg of Bystolic for 5 weeks now.  I was switched from Lisinopril (took for 6 weeks), which was causing breathing problems, sinus issues, extreme fatigue and frequent dizziness.  All of these side effects went away within a week of stopping the medication.  Bystolic has slowed my heart rate down, and eased my White Coat Syndrome quite a bit.  During dr's visits, I would get up to 170/110 (130/70 at home).  Now, I am reading around 130/75 in dr's office, and I'm not having any negative side effects, as with the other BP meds I was taking.  So far, I am very pleased with this drug.

I have had excellent initial results from Bystolic 2.5 for my blood pressure. However, I'm having diarrhea and hoping to find a way to solve this problem so I can stay on the med. I've been taking it after dinner.
I just started taking this med, I am getting off tropol, which did not control my 180/100. I am just hoping it works for me

This will only be day 3 for me on Bystolic.  I am only taking half of a 5mg tablet, but I also take enalapril 10 in the evening. I was already dizzy and tired before starting Bystolic.  The first day I was exhausted to new levels, but yeaterday and today I feel awesome and not dizzy anymore.  However I am nervous my BP has been dropping about 15-20 points per day on this drug and I am afraid it will go too low... in 3 days I have gone from avg or 140/95 to today 99-64.  Heart rate dropped from 108 to 73.  But at the moment I feel great.
Less side effects,I'm not as tired, my legs do not hurt.

This is by far the worst medicine I have ever taken.  I've been so sick can't get off the bed.  Headaches, dizzyness, shaking, nausea...you name it, this one gives it to me.  Can't wait for Mon. so I can get off this poison.

SEVERE fatigue, dizziness, slight nausea.  I am very active and athletic.  This is NOT a drug I would ever recommend for an athlete.  Before taking Bystolic, I could play sports at a high level.  Since taking Bystolic for a week, I am literally unable to compete and require constant resting periods just to participate in a medium-high level workout.  If you're a competitior, try something besides a Beta Blocker!  I'm going back to Enalypril 20mg daily.  Bystolic will lower your BP and your desire to do amnything bul lay around he house and gain weight!

This medication has worked to lower my BP, from around 150/110 to 115/65 on average. It also helps with my anxiety and benign PVCs. The only side effects I have experienced are feeling drowsy and light-headed. I feel a little "out-of-it" some days.
Other high blood pressure meds caused excessive drowsiness.  Bystolic does not cause drowsiness.

Was diagnosed w/"white coat hypertension" three years ago. My doc prescribed Toprol XL initially, which caused insidious depression,insomnia,nightmares,weight gain & hair loss. When I described my symptoms he never acknowledged they could be totally drug related, instead he suggested additional drugs to ease the new symptoms. Thru message boards like this I learned that beta blockers are notorious for provoking such symptoms.Having researched Bystolic on my own I asked to try it. At first I felt great and it lowered my BP better than the Toprol; however, eventually the awful symptoms returned: the insomnia, depression. weight gain & hair loss, although less severe than on Toprol. Also, developed slight heart flutter and joint pain. I'm certain it's related to the Bystolic as symptoms have eased since I began cutting the 2.5mg pill in half. My BP @ home averages 112/73. As my BP is of the "white coat" variety,I am determined to get my stress and anxiety levels, which provoke it, under control naturally so I can stop taking these nasty drugs. I feel as though the last three years of my life have been terribly compromised by the side effects of these drugs.

Been on Bystolic 10mg over 5 months now.
At the beginning I had dizziness, fatigue, trouble with sleep and weakness during exercise but now since my body has adjusted, it is all gone.
I am very happy with the results of Bystolic.
I am very active & exercise 5 days per week, brisk walks 2 to 3 miles per day and jog for 5 minutes without problems.
Bystolic helps me control stress and anxiety, I feel much calmer.
I have not gained weight, contrary I have lost 10 pounds.
Before, my High Blood Pressure will go to 170-190 over 100-110, now readings are: Morning (wakeup) 125-130 over 70-75
Resting pulse (wakeup) 56-60.
The only con is the price of medication, Bystolic $50.00 per 30 pills
I have no insurance
I've been on Bystolic for 3 days now. I have extreme fatique, leg cramps, and headaches. BP was running 227/109 now 180/107. I'd rather it be high than feel like this.

I have been taking this drug for some time now.  I feel extremely tired all the time.  I often feel like I am in a fog.  Sometimes I can't sleep & sometimes I sleep like a rock. still in question

I have been on this medicine for about 2 weeks now. After taking lisinopril for 1 week, with horrible side effects, this is a miracle drug for me. The side effects are minimal and my bp has been lowered considerably.

I have had bad reactions to almost every blood pressure drug I've been on.  When my dr. gave me Bystolic I was hoping for something that would really help me.  And, for the first week it did.  It was great - lowered my bp to around 116/78.  But then, I started having itching and irritated eyelids.  I thought it was a reaction to make-up.  But, after several days of not using the make-up the problem got worse.  By that time I was also having a metalic taste.  And my eyelids were swollen half shut.  After two days off Bystolic the swelling and itching in my eyelids stopped. Also I was having what the dr. called "tennis elbow."  That has also gone away since I've been off Bystolic.  I was hopeful, but this drug does not work for me.
My doctor put me on this medicine and my blood pressure has been almost perfect ever since.

I have been on Bystolic for 3 weeks along with other hypertensives and have had leg and foot cramps 3-4 times a week, and problems with sleeping.  The most problematic side effect was chest pain, sometimes dull, other times sharp during the first week.  I had never had chest pains prior to this drug.  I plan to discontinue this drug in the near future since I have read more medical literature on this medication and find that it is not a preferred treatment for folks with hypertension.

Bystolic scared me at first because of the newness.  I search it on the web and hardly NO information on it.   My dr. is Indian and new to the game.  I started out with a low HCTZ however it slowly stopped working for me.  He introducted me to Bystolic and said it was new.  It was so new my pharmacy had to order it. My pressure readings were 156/90 which is Stage 1. After a week on it I have had readings as low as 117/77. Which is GREAT! however I still have moderate to high reading but I think its because I get nevrous before the reading.  I suffer from Generalized Anxiety Disorder so I get nervous easliy.  So that may contribute to the off readings.

I can say that BYSTOLIC is one of the best beta blockers currently available.  I have tried several beta blockers (including TOPROL XL). BYSTOLIC is excellent for heart rate control and is also much gentler on the gastro system in comparison to other beta blockers. BYSTOLIC does not have the negative effects on mental functioning such as forgetfullness, mood changes and weird/vivid dreams. It also will improve sexual functioning over time. You need to give this pill time to perform it's magic as your body adjusts. The main side effect's I've had are feeling tired, slight weight increase and occasional joint pains. Keep in mind that every pill has side effects. This is a true all in one pill. It provides vasodilation, works on the Angiotensin sytem, increases nitric oxide, relaxes the heart rate, has blood platelet effects, and controls blood pressure. You do not need to take other HBP medications if your blood pressure is controlled. A problem with this pill is the standard 5mg tablet which is very inconvenient to split in half because it has no score line and is triangular shape. The manufacturer believes that with the 5mg tablet, one size fits all, and everyone should be prescribed 5mg. I disagree, I'm doing fine on 2.5 mg (so far). I can always work my way upward. You will be hard pressed to find a better beta blocker on the market. TOPROL is the second best choice and the gold standard of beta blockers. It is effective, and well researched with a proven record for hypertension, heart failure, MI and arrythmia. It is also known throughout the world.  KERLONE/BETAXOLOL is my second best choice, but the manufacturer has had a recall due to generic screw-ups etc. KERLONE is exactly like TOPROL but with less side effects such as weird dreams and fatigue.

After 6 wks. have new side effects, tightness in throat, ringing in ears, overall bad feeling. Can't decide if the feeling of shortness of breath is from the throat tightness or lungs. Feel like an extra breath is needed. Right forearm feels weak at times. Feel like I'm in a zone at times and can't escape the overall blah feeling. Have also developed some coughing which seems to exacerbate the tightness and breathless feeling. This is a confusing drug, wondering if it is the lesser of the other evils or if something bette can be had. Afraid to experiment after reading other reviews. Help!

I also have more digestive upset.  I feel miserable!  I was taking 5mg but my dr. upped it to 10mg because my BP wasn't lowering.  The side effects are worsening.  I've been on so many different BP meds and I can't find one that my body tolerates. I was diagnosed with hypertention, and put on this medication. Within 2 days it had lowered my blood pressure to where it needed to be, with no side effects.

Unfortunately Bystolic is very expensive.  I will ask my doctor for something less expensive, that should do the same thing, Hopefully it will work.

Started this Rx on 10/31 and it took two weeks until I saw results - from 140s/80s to 110/65. I swim for exercise - 6 miles per week. I did feel tired in the first week, but after that I have felt back to normal.  I'm at normal weight for my height and have no other medical conditions or Rx's.

Switching from atenolol to Bystolic has greatly improved my life. I was on atenolol for 4-5 years and was always tired and complaining of feeling old and worn out. I would crawl out of bed in the morning and feel as if I had not even slept. Switched to Bystolic several weeks ago and my energy level is beyond belief.  I now realiz how truly miserable I was on atenolol and wondering if I was actually suffering from depression and did not know it.  Love this medication even though it will cost me more.

Although medication has lowered my blood pressure, it has caused GI problems such as heart burn, burping, etc.

I have been experiencing heart palpitations for the past few months. My heart doctor did a stress test and everything was normal. I am currently taking Lisonpril and Verapimil. My doctor gave me samples of Bystolic and I took one as soon as I left the office. Believe it or not, I have not had any palpitations since taking the pill. I don't feel anxious and out of breath like I used to. I used to be able to feel my heart pounding in my chest and at night I could not sleep on my left side because my heart was beating so hard into the mattress that I couldn't sleep. I no longer have that problem. I have not experienced any side effects yet and hopefully I won't. If this drug works this well this fast, I'm definitely staying on it even though it is expensive. I feel like my normal self again. I would recommend Bystolic to anyone who is experiencing heart palpitations.

I was prescribed 5 mg. Bystolic to control my blood pressure (130+/80+) and to lower my pulse rate (80-100+, with 70+ being normal). Overnight it worked to bring my readings down to well within normal ranges. The only problem I had was that the first week I took it, the following day I would suddenly go to sleep without warning, alarming to say the least. As instructed, I took half a tablet instead, and still got the full effect of the medication without the odd side effect. It's nice to no longer feel my heart/pulse racing or worry about my BP -- a wonder drug!

I had numerous side effects for the first 3-4 months with Bystolic, but all but one has subsided: it does make my sleeping very light, and I often can't sleep more than 5 hours.  Consequently, my doctor prescribed an SSRI anti-depressant, Lexapro, which completely regulates my seratonin and makes me sleep well. Otherwise, Bystolic is great and has completely lowered my BP.

I've been taking this for a little over a month now. My heart rate and blood pressure have both dropped greatly. Here's the downside, I have become very tired and sluggish and have been packing on the pounds like a bear preparing for winter.

Believe or it not, I have been fighting my blood pressure for 2+ years.  At the age of 35, I could not control it any longer.  This is literally the 12th medication I have been prescribed in 2 years.

I began taking this drug about 6 months ago.  I was on Toprol XL before.  It has worked relatively well, but between the two, I am probably going to go back on Toprol.  The main side effects of this drug for me have been lack of sleep.  I have gone from 7-8 hours per night to 4-5 and that lack of sleep is causing headaches and other problems.  I have gained weight, and have had heartbeat irregularities.  Some of that has subsided in the past month because of a reduced stress level, but notice that the condition returns under certain stress conditions.  All in all, I think it is an excellent drug for BP control, but just not as effective for me as Toprol.  I also had side effects with Toprol of fatigue and weakness, but never tested poorly on liver tests.  Between the two, I would take Toprol and getting more sleep.

After taking this med just once (5mg) I felt horrible. I am presently taking Depakote for anxiety/panic attacks which already slows me down and to take Bystolic made me feel like a zombie. dry mouth, slow pulse rate, weakness. I am also taking Clonidine so these symtons could be from either drug.

I’ve had experiences with quite a few beta blockers over the past few years. All the Bystolic hype about being third generation etc. is rubbish. It provides vasodilation and is beta1 specific, so are many other beta blockers. (If you read the sites Prescribing information for this medication it causes Leydig Cell and SPERM cell damage.)The least side effect claims are all marketing ploys. This pill known as Nebivolol (BYSTOLIC)has been around in Europe since the early 1990’s. The same time period as TOPROL, ZEBETA and KERLONE. It is not that new and drug companies shouldn’t exagerate or twist the facts. I can say that Bystolic definitely has it’s share of side effects, including water retention, sexual dysfunction, forgetfullnes, increases in Cholesterol and Glucose levels and worst of all, Increased Liver enzymes. The best and safest choice for a beta blocker which I have been currently taking is KERLONE, known as BETAXOLOL. Compared to other beta blockers it is pretty remarkable, though not advertised or very popular. Best of all no sexual side effects, less joint pain, and better sleep patterns.

After having my first child my blood pressure went to 200/135. IV medication couldn't even bring it down. Once I started Bystolic it was down to normal again. I thank God that my Dr.finally found something that probably saved my life. I have no side effects either.

For those complaining about the BYSTOLIC side effects after switching from other beta blockers such as TOPROL/METOPROLOL, make sure you were not taking the generic versions. THE FDA has recalled all generic METOPROLOL/TOPROL manufactured by ETHEX and SANDOZ. Make sure you try the brand drug called TOPROL-XL (Astra Zeneca) or LOPRESSOR (NOVARTIS pharm) before switching. CONSUMER LABS has reported these pill issues with some of the generics in Apil 2008.

I have been on bystolic for 3 weeks now. Started with 10mg. ,B/P stayed up..now up to 20mg/day. Pulse is slow 46/min.but I am a runner and it has always been in the 50's.B/p is marginally lower. Bystolic has a web site: bystolic.com. What worries me is that BYSTOLIC can cause testicular problems and sperm damage. I don't think I plan to have any more children anyway... but the carcinogen study is troublesome. Other beta blockers are much safer.
  Part of the Information states:
"Carcinogenesis, Mutagenesis, Impairment of Fertility.

Bystolic 5 mg, (one does only thus far) lowered my bp and pulse greatly. However, I cannot function. Took the first does on 6/18/09 at 6:30 p.m. It is now 6/20/09 at 12:30 pm, and am still feeling dizzy, slightly blurring vision and cannot function well. I have been on many, many bp meds throughout the time since being diagnosed with high bp. ALL meds have given me severe and persistent negative side effects - difficulty breathing, significant hair loss, swollen and paralized tongue/throat areas (couldn't move my tongue/throat to swollow, then when I told the doc, he doubled my dose. No, I didn't go for that); joint pain, horrible thoughts, arm/fingers doing to sleep to the point I couldn't turn off my alarm clock; constipation, very dry cough throughout the day and night, fatique with some meds and fatigue because the cough would keep me up all night; and many, many more symptoms. I just want to say to all of you taking these bp meds, that if you are feeling a symptom, you most likely are. You know your body, trust your judgment. When I first experienced the hair loss, the doc said, "It's not from the medication...it's menopause..." Well, I stopped taking the med and went on a different one. The hair loss stopped! Prior to taking the Bystolic, I was on a regimen of 30 mg Procardia, XL, and 12.5 mg(doc said to take 25 mg - I cut the dose knowing the difficulties I have). It seems to be working ok. However, prior to the Procardia, 30 mg XL, I was on the 60 mg XL. 60 mg was too strong. It did lower my bp but pulse was usually higher than what I would like. Throughout the last 3 years or so, I have been experiencing "unexplained waves of anxiety (they stopped as quickly as they would come on), faint-like episodes, palpitations, arrested breathing, and 3 trips to the ER. My doc who prescribed the Procardia, suggested I stop taking Protonix (acid reflux caused by bp meds). I stopped such and for now, no waves of anxiety, no difficulty breathing. Trust your gut! Alia

I am a 65 year old male and have high blood pressure for over 20 years.  I had NO symptoms and functioned very well.  That is why hbp is called the silent killer.  BYSTOLIC is a killer for sure.  I advise you NOT to take this drug under any circumstances.  I was on the drug for one year at 10 mg.  I had nightmares right away from it.  After 10 months, the balls of my feet swelled up and my toes became numb. I began to get dizzy and had to pull off the road when driving. I had a tightness in my chest that felt like a python was squeezing me to death.  I was short of breath during conversations on the phone.I also had rectal bleeding with the bowel movements.  This all started at the 10'th month or so.  The dr said its all in my head and I demanded to get off it.  He told me to take 5 mg for one week and then 2.5 for another week.  After the third pill of 2.5 I felt like I was going to die and he was on vacation and nobody in the office would see me but a pa.  I went to another dr and he said I would NOT have given you that drug but now that you were on it, we have to work around it.  He put me back on 5 mg for a month and 2.5 for a month and put me on norvasc 5 mg during that weaning time.  Now I am off Bystolic and have the Norvasc at 10 mg.  I feel MUCH better. DO NOT TAKE BYSTOLIC UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES. Beta blockers are very dangerous from what I have learned and the gold standard is TOPROL or LOPRESSOR if you need a beta blocker.  The Bystolic is a fraud and I urge you NOT to take it unless you want to come to deaths door.

Sonia - The manufacturer of this drug is Forest Pharmaceutical. 
Note: In regard to your insurance not covering this drug, have your doctor write a letter stating that you cannot tolerate the other beta blockers you were taking in the past, and you had a bad allergic reaction with several others. The company has no choice, unless they go against the doctors orders and risk a law suit. I agree, Bystolic is an excellent beta blocker and energy levels are definitely increased, compared to some other beta blockers. It is also excellent for inflammatory problems, such as high CRP levels, arthritis and stomach issues. I beleive Bystolic helped my colitis. I've had almost no symptoms in over 1 year. Sexual function has also improved in many ways, versus other medications I was taking. Good luck with the Insurance company.

As mentioned in the post below by "Kiki" and others. Bystolic does not appear to be a pill for long term use. All research trials lasted less than 6 months, most were 3 months. It seems 75% of the side effects kick in after about 6 months. The worse side effect with this medication after almost 1 year of use were my limbs falling asleep, even when walking. Hands also constantly fell asleep and loose stools became almost a daily problem. This made me realize the importance and benefit of taking a proven and reliable medication (like Toprol/Atenolol)which some patients have been taking for close to 30 years at very high doses, with great effectiveness and no toxicity. If no one's been taking this pill for more than 3 years, we don't really know if this pill with last the test of time. The 'SENIORS" trial which was the largest Bystolic clinical trial for heart failure, did not show good results after 1 year of patient use. Toprol and Coreg results were great. Thats why Toprol and Coreg are approved for Heart failure and MI. 2 weeks ago the FDA refused to approve Bystolic for heart failure, because the results were far from the Toprol/Coreg results.

I began taking Bystolic shortly after its FDA approval. It was touted in ads by Forest Labs, the manufacturer, as being "novel" and a "new generation beta blocker"-implying that the side effects typical of the beta blocker class of drugs would be less pronounced with Bystolic.I had been having side effects with the beta blocker,ToprolXL so I asked my doc if I could try it. A drug rep had apparently gotten to him already as my doc assured me that the Bystolic would be much better tolerated. He wrote me a new script for it. I have been on the drug now for almost two years. At first it worked rather well but as another reviewer has posted, I feel it might have the potential to become "toxic" after awhile. Side effects have slowly grown to include severe insomnia, occasional shortness of breath, depression, weight gain and recently and most annoying of all, tinnitus...a humming sound in my ears. Most troubling is that along with all these adverse side effects Bystolic also seems to lose its effectiveness as an anti-hypertensive after awhile. After about two years my blood pressure began to fluctuate, whereas initially Bystolic controlled it reasonably well. I switched back to Toprol XL and my blood pressure stabilized within a few days. Some of the side effects are easing. Unfortunately, the Toprol also has similar nasty side effects, but at least it does what it's supposed to do. I will also mention that the company that manufactures Bystolic was reprimanded and warned by the FDA back in August 28, 2008 for what the FDA considered misleading advertising. The language of their ads implied that Bystolic had a more tolerable side effect profile; however the FDA ordered them to cease making such claims. Like many of you I am SO fed up with the nasty side effects of the drugs available for those of us with hypertension. I also wish physicians would stop their tendency to dismiss our reports of adverse drug side effects. I feel they rely too heavily on the drug reps.
First the doctor put me on Coreg which worked great but made me extremely tired.  She switched me to Bystolic and I have a lot more energy now. As a college student, I need all the energy I can get!

My blood pressure was up a little and my family Dr. sent me to a cardiologist because he said they were the experts on controlling bp. He put me on Bystolic 5mg twice a day. I started taking it on March 5th and on March 14th(Sunday night) I started feeling bad and went to the Dr. on Monday and was told I probably had a virus. I was told to quit taking all my medicine for 24 hours and come back in a week unless I got worse. I was tired & weak Wed. & Thur. but felt pretty good. Thur. through the night I got short of breath and felt horible. Friday I could barely walk and had to hold to something to get through the house (felt terrible) I went to Dr. and the nurse kept getting a very low BP reading. They took a EKG which showed my heart skipping beats for 4 or 5 seconds at a time. I was immediately sent to the hospital and was put on a monitor and giving IV for 3 days to get the Bystolic out of my system. On the 3rd day my heart beat got back to normal. I went home and went to Dr. the next day and am waiting on blood work results now.  This drug almost killed me. I would advise everyone NOT TO TAKE BYSTOLIC   It might work for some people but not for me.

My BP was 150/98 so I started working out everyday. Several weeks later, took my BP three times over a 2 week period and it was 139/78, 143/77, and 139/84..i'm thinking i'm doing alright getting my BP down naturally although the top number is still a little high, I'm told that it's the bottom one you really need to watch. Then i go to the Dr for something unrelated, they take my bp and it's 150/100 !1 WTF !! So they send me for an echo-cardiogram and discover I have LVH. They put me on 5mg daily of Bystolic. Three days later i take my bp and it's 123/78....perfect !! i have no side effects but i noticed when I work out now instead of my heartbeat being in the 150-160 range it never goes over 130. i guess the medication reduces the workload on the heart. I have been taking Bystolic for over a year. Dr. started me on 10mg. It was so much for me, so I cut it in half. After a few months still more side effects. Heart palpitations, trouble sleeping, lower back pain, some hair lose and thinning of hair. So I decided to cut the 5mg in half to 2.5mg. I should say my BP the first time I went to the Dr. was 200/110. It is now down to average 138/78. This is the lowest my BP has ever been in my life. My main side effect right now is what I think is something to do with my stomach. I get a very sharp pain on my right side about 4 inches to the right of my belly button, usually when I eat or drink anything. I was taking my pill right before going to bed. Now, I try to take it at least an hour before bed so it will go through my system a little and get out of my stomach. I think my main complaint about this medication would be the sudden waking up in the middle of the night and not being able to go back to sleep for hours. I sure hope and pray that the med is not damaging my other organs. I have had no headaches, no dizzyness and no tiredness.

i have noticed that about an hour after taking my bystolic i am able to fall asleep very easily.  my blood pressure is well controlled and have experienced no side effects that i am aware of.

It hasnt brought my B.P. down- range between
135/75 to 180/99- to compensate for the
 headaches, joint pain & just overall bad
feeling.
This medication has worked well for me.

I have reduced the dosage by half in consultation with my doctor. I was experiencing angina, thirst, flushing, headaches, palpitations, back pain,etc. So, cut the dose after bp dropped to 100/68. Did not feel quite right, bp (100/68) had angina etc so was willing to try reduction. Well, after reduction, bp staying at low 120/78. Not bad. The angina appears to have greatly improved. Overall, I am pleased with current results. Corrected concentrated urine by much greater water and gatorade increase. The only MAJOR problem I am having is the back pain. It's miserable. I am using the 80mg asprin and I think that should alleviate it (just started);however, must resolve this problem. Has anyone else found a solution for the backache? I know several posts discussed the symptom. So far apart from this problem very happy with my progress. Previously had stated complete frustration and felt like I needed to get off of med. One thing I can honestly say was I have never had a bp pill work so effectively in such a short time to dramatically improve my BP...overnight!! If only I can lick this back problem. I then hope to move onto (with doc's approval) not having to take norvasc and hztc in conjunction. I am having to take all three currently to maintain bp reading as above. Any advice greatly appreciated.

heart rate and blood pressure shot up suddenly. My pounding heart was really scarring me. Apparently, this can happen after open heart surgery, a reaction.  My heart rate and bp came way down within in a day of starting Bystolic but so did my energy level.  I felt dizzy and fuzzy headed, weird g.i. problems and depression. I became very short of breath and my heart was pounding as bad as before starting. My doctor canceled my appointment and said he would see me in three months. After a week and a half I started reducing my 5mg dose by half then a quarter. Second day off completely and my chest hurt and I felt I could not breath. Third day off, a little better. This is a scary drug.

Added to daily BP meds. After 6 months has painful gas, bloating & diarea. Also shortness of breath, interrupted sleep and all around tiredness and no pep. Stopped taking the 20MG. daily pill and symptoms went away in 48 hrs. DR. will try something else. Not a good med for me.
works good .even good when I have an attack.I have a sensitive stomach and it doesn't bother it at all.

This drug was the worst BP MED i ever taken.Had to stop in 2 days.Off med but still not right yet. I had headache upset belly heartburn and gas. No energy tired.so i will be calling Doctor to change. ASAP first thing monday morning.

I have been taking bystolic for 5 years, started on 5mg increased to 10mg. I started on BP meds 15 years ago, 164/94. BP now: 164/80. Heartrate from 80 to 60. I've tried about everything. I have found that despite what they say, nothing really works or has terrible side effects. Now, if I stop BP goes wild. I wish I had never started on BP meds.
no known problems

Extreme low blood pressure
Slow heart beat
Dizzy
Tireness
Feet always cold
Feeling of asma / wheezing
Could hear and feel my heartbeat all the time and had hard time sleeping be cause of hearing and feeling it. 
Felt like ‘valves’ or something weren’t working  properly, not something I have felt before.

This Med has made me miserable and felt like I was going to have heart attack any minute.  Took it just few days and shortness of breath began and steadily got worse!  AFter 2 months I can barely walk across floor!  Have stomach problems, starting to get muscle cramps, very sleepy all the time and gaining weight!  This stuff is HORRID!  Not worth trying. It did bring bp down but not worth the side effects.

It all makes sense now. The weight gain, tired, sexual problems, swelling, joint pain, that I already had, got worse. My doctor has me taking Bystolic along with Amlodipine Besylate, both 5mg. It worked great to lower my BP but my god I was a zombee. Exforge is what I was taking. It also helped with my BP, but my potasium was a little, but I now know why. I was consstipated all the time. I started taking something, a laxative and now my potasium is 4.5 perfect. I hope this helps someone, because this is no fun.

I have finally had to give up this drug. As far as blood pressure reduction this drug was extremely effective. Many of the initial side effects:shortness of breath, angina (tightness in chest), palpitations, irregular heartbeat, dizzyness, able to overcome over time. However, could not get rid of the pain in my back, particularly first thing in the morning. Essentially had to crawl out of bed and take a few hours walking around until back pain subsided. Did not want to take another medication in order to alleviate back pain. Fatigue was still a big problem. Fatigue had subsided somewhat, but still a major concern. I have tried to be proactive regarding the back pain. To that end went to urologists to check prostrate. Enlarged prostrate etc, can cause similar symptoms. Prostrate was fine no problems there so can eliminate prostrate but still suspect Bystolic. I now, during a scheduled physical, will have a kidney work up etc to make sure nothing is going on. In a way I am disappointed to have to come off of Bystolic. Drug is really effective for BP control and I had hoped to come off of Norvasc and HCTZ and just have to use Bystolic. Dr. felt needed to take me off and has prescribed SECTRAL. I wish I was as fortunate as previous post...Way to go Lucy!
Causes too much drowsiness.  Easily fall sleep at inapproiate times. I believe I need a reduced dosage, minimal at 2.5 mg

also taking HCTZ for high BP, was given this drug for irregular beats (pvc's).  It doesnt do much for the BP, but lessened the pvc's.  Ran out once for a few days, pvc's worsened.  Side effects have been muscle cramps, HOT FLASHES and severe sweating, mild indigestion.

So far this is the best med., for me.

I was taking another for over 10 years and it was doing horrible things to me.

My Cardio put me on Bystolic and within a week I felt like a new person for the better!

After being on Bystolic for a week and a half I started getting hot flashes and sweating everywhere 4 to 5 times daily.  After 2 or 3 times of this happening I could hardly stand my own smell.  On to try something else.  Have tried 4 BP meds, all with side effects I could not live with.
extreme pain in my hip that has also gone to lower back.enough pain that it is hard to walk.bad pain in legs from knee down at night which makes it impossible to sleep
I believe this medicine cause rapid hair loss.

Update to previous posts-my latest interesting ?side effect? is cold urticaria. I clutch a cold bottle of pop wedged against the flesh of my forearm as I go back to the office-total exposure 1-2minutes. 3 times left, 2 times right, forearm-only where the bottle made contact-itching, followed by many tiny bumps under the skin, followed by more intense itching, bumps surface/scab over/dry out and go away again.

Originally prescribed 10 mg, cut down to 5 mg. Very tired so I started taking it at night, but that hasn't helped.  Was on it for about a month when back pain started.  It is very bad in the morning.  I have started taking Motrin to combat it.  Diarrhea was very bad for about a month, then got a little better.  Now after about 3 months, it's back and now I have severe lower abdominal pain, like I'm all blocked up, along with lower back pain and sometimes pain under my ribs.  The side effects are terrible and I see my PCP in 2 days to try another one (this is my 3rd BP med).  I will say that my BP was 180/110 prior to Bystolic, now at 117/78, pulse down from 120 to 78, so it does work, but the side effects are killing me.

I am having trouble with very bad muscle weakness and weight gain. the weakness is primarily in my legs. I also have trouble with breathing when walking short distances. has anyone else experienced any of these problems

I began taking 5 mg of Bystolic in March 2011.  I was diagnosed with Anxiety and Panic Attacks and slightly elevated blood pressure.  The Bystolic does a great job of lowering my blood pressure so that I can manage my panic attacks.  I do have to be careful and check my blood pressure twice daily because the Bystolic will lower my BP too low which makes me tired and dizzy especially when I get alot of exercise.  I wish it came in a lower dose so I could take a 2.5mg dose daily with an extra one when I have a panic attack if needed.  Mild Side effects that I have had are tiredness, dizziness and needing to make sure that I eat every 3-4hours.  As I have lost weight and started exercising more I have had to check that my BP is not too low.  The goal of course is to get off the medicine by adopting a healthier life style through diet, exercise, yoga and meditation.  Seems to be working.

I been taking this for a about month and has it pros and cons i will start with the pros it does a good job lowering bp and heart rate be fore meds  i was 140 over 88 and now 100/60 usually at rest. i feel better but this drug dose make u have angina. and headaches and some mild fatiuge i also had alot of sweating when i frist started it. Im still not sure if it is for me or not. i will update next month
upset stomach, feet falling to sleep, head ache

this medicine has decreased my husbands sex drive and maintaining an erection

Been on bystolic for about 4 months and nearly killing me!  Wrote before about all the bad effects, tired, headache,etc. Then found my psorisis has gotten way worse, then hair falling out to less then half!  Dr. taking me off slowly and been to er twice in last week for palpitations, bradycardia, and pulse down to 41!  Hurting all over so bad I can barely stand it and have another week before off this killing med!  If the cure doesn't get you the getting off med will!  Be very careful when stopping!  This review has saved me so many times.  Just be careful of all meds!

i had taken bystolic for about 5 months.  I had started with stomach pains first then it would go away.  Long story short this month i ended up in hospital over week. doctors could not figure out why i could not stop throwing up and have bad stomach pains. I had about 5 tests done for other things that could cause this but all tests came back negative.  Finally one of the hospitals doctors evaluated my medication and changed my blood pressure pills.  For the first time in months i slept all night.  Bystolic almost killed. Please read side effects because I had most of them.

BP and Heart Rate good.Very tired ,headaches stomash pain and last but not least very depressed. My fibromyalgia pain has gotten more intense and different.Several body parts and systems hurt in a way they  have not hurt in the last 34 years.

Bystolic is an effective treatment for hypertension, but its side effects make its use unpleasant.  It makes me very tired.  I try to take if after my other medications, later in the morning, after I exercise and do my usual routine.  Sometimes this drug puts me on the nod.  I have been using if for over 6 months.
Blood pressure normalized with bystolic use, but experienced dizziness, nausea, tiredness and some swelling in ankles. Also, difficulty with cardio exercise, some shortness of breath.
it has helped me keep my blood pressure down to a level that I am please with, (normal).

My doctor prescribed Bystolic 10 mg and then 20 mg after taking me off Exforge 10/320 mg  (at my request due to various side effects) and Tekturna 300 mg. I was taking both for about 2 yrs and then developed some uncomfortable side effects such as hot flashes (which really sucks in this hot summer) occasional muscle pain/weakness, fatigue/tiredness and depression from the side effects. My pressure was good ranging from 120/80 to 136/88 at my last doctor's visit. I've been on Bystolic for about 3 weeks, about one week at 20 mg and haven't experienced a marked decrease in my blood pressure (my pressure spiked after getting off Exforge and Tekturna alone did not work), 178/110 and have the uncomfortable experience of hot flashes, trouble sleeping at night, some chest pains, itching, and EXCESSIVE sweating. My doctor has tried other drugs with Bystolic, (including Tekturna) Ramipril and Benicar, but I've had to discontinue both after a few days after  allergic reactions to both (itching all over).  I have an allergy to sulfa in medications and most bp diuretics are sulfa drugs. I've requested to go back on Exforge, at a smaller dosage, and Tekturna, because at least my bp was under control with the side effects and not itching!  Really frustrated at this point and afraid to continue trying any more sulfa bp medicines that I'm allergic to. Now I understand my doctor's concerns/frustration with prescribing me meds for my pressure.

Just stared taking this medication my blood pressure was at 153/112 took my pressure this morning it drop to 103/83 i still getting anxious,bad headache not sleeping bad dreams sweating my stomach is very bloated.
**My husband has been on this medication and has loss all his sexual desire and has difficulty getting an erection.
I have experienced fatigue and dizziness

Bystolic makes me sweat sweat sweat especially in the early morning hours. I have been on this pill for about a year and half and I always feel tired and feel as if I am walking in a fog. I feel dizzy and light headed. For the first time ever my blood tests came back with slightly elevated liver enzymes!  Time to change meds or doctor!  I want to feel human again.

Have been on 5mg Bystolic/Benicar for one month, bp is fantastic 118/82.
First three weeks was horrible, but I blame it on me going cold turkey on the chewing tobacco after 25 years. The doc put me on lexapro as well. I have noticed some chest tightness and shortness of breath on days when it is more humid. I generally lift and do cardio every day. Exercise is coming back slowly, will probably never be the same but its better than being 6 feet under. For the first time in my life I can go to sleep without worrying that my heart is going to explode. resting pulse is down to 64. A little tough to get the pulse up during exercise 102. A little tired, cough, but It takes time for opur bodies to adjust to such a severe change. I was rushed to the emergency room from almost passing out, my BP was 220/190, generally I was rolling at 150/100. Felt great alll the time but I was killing myself. This is my first real experience with BP meds so for me Bystolic has been great.
I have had high blood pressure that other meds didn't help.  I have been taking this med a week now and my pressure had dropped to normal and so has my heart rate.  So far, this med seems to work.

I have on occasion had headaches, dizziness, swelling in legs and tingling in feet and hands. Over all I have had a good experience, was on daily, now since cardiologist visit, reduced to every other day!! Lost 25 lbs, goal is to get off completely and increase exercise.
Makes you tired all the time.

Taken for 3 days and have diahrrea, stomach bloating, vomiting, severe gas.

There are MANY blood pressure med's out there that work great and don't have these terrible side effects!!!
BEWARE!!!!!

Been taking Bystolic 5mg. for 2 years. B.P.seems to have elevated in past 6-8 months. Can't get thru the night w/o waking up,usually sleep 3-4  hours at a time per night Then trouble falling asleep again. Also fatigued. I'm very active. I run about 20-25 miles par week and weight train 2-3 a week. Now,I have been having bouts of depression the past 6 months.I'm going to monitor by BP and watch my diet until the First of the year. Then See my Doctor.

Today is Wednesday and I started this medication Monday afternoon. I had a cluster headache for over a week before I started this medication. I thought it was from a cold that I had (maybe an ear infection) because the headache was on the left side of my head and was an excruciating, throbbing pain that would not go away not matter what I took. I was taking Verapamil, very high dose, Extended Release, and my blood pressures got very high 150/100. I am only 33 yrs old, but it runs in my family. I am also a migraine sufferer, so the headache did not surprise me. My doctor put me on the Bystolic Monday afternoon and said I could take one right away since my bp was so high. The cluster headache went away within a day. I was taking pain meds for it too, but I took my blood pressure this morning and it was 109/80. I had to do a double-take! LOL! My bp has not been that low for at least two years! I could not believe it!!! I have been a little sleepy here and there, but it is midnight now, so I must not be doing too bad because I am a night person, but I also had a nap earlier, due to the sleepiness and I normally don't take naps. Maybe the high bp gave me more energy before??? So far, no side effects except for feeling a little more sleepy than usual, but I am VERY HAPPY that my blood pressure is now alot lower in such a short time. I will be sticking with this unless some drastic side effect pops up that I can't stand. But down almost 50 points in two days, that is remarkable to me. I feel so much better now. I am way too young for my blood pressure to get as high as it did!!!! This medication definitely got my blood pressure down!
Within a week of taking this drug I began to have intense back spasms in my mid to lower right side of my back. I thought I had strained my back at the gym but figured out it was the drug.

I've been on bystolic for about one year.Seemed to be doing great.My heart at rest would be anywhere from 52-58ppm.Lately I've been getting terrible hot flashes,night sweats.I walk around with clammy skin.Also getting stomach pains.After reading others experiences  with this drug,I think it is time for me to see my Dr.Noticed that there are no side effects listed like this???

Lisinopril was giving me extreme cold/flu symptoms after starting one month after taking it. Doctor prescribed Bystolic Oral to see if it would be effective and not have the side effects. Been on Bystolic for 2 weeks and no side effects yet. Will not be sure until 2 months of taking this drug.

Update on my recent review. Following my first review, I found the side effects kicking in. I learned that it can take a couple of weeks or so for it to happen. I became deathly tired after taking the med in the AM. Severe side effects such as swollen legs/feet/ankles/hands. Headaches, trouble breathing and bp went back up and palpitations returned. It actually became a nightmare. I called my cardio dr. and he removed me from bystolic and put me back on atenolol-Iwill prob have palpitations but within a week or so it should drop my bp down again and side effects should slowly dwindle. Going to have ablation after the holidays for the palps. I loved it at first- thought it was the real deal but side effects for me were detrimental.

The side effects of this drug are unpleasant to say the least. My Dr told me that there weren't any side effects. I started noticeing stomach pains, have tingling in one foot and swollen ankle. My sleep has been disturbed. Can't remember the last time I had a full nights sleep. I wake up feeling funky and stranger but am ok once I am out of bed. I don't suffer much dizziness. I have expeienced problems with a burning mouth before but I believe this med has made it worse. I quit smoking cold turked 2 years and have experience weight gain but I believe the Bystolic has contributed to additional pounds. I can put up with theee side effects since my BP and all my labs were good but I don't think I like the sleep disturbances and thats why I feel so tired during the day and I would like a cure to my burning mouth. I went to an ENT and he tells me not much to do about this problem but am hoping if I come off this med it will help.

Was on 4 other meds in the past 2 1/2 years and all had very bad side effects. Atenolol worked great but had swelling and a few minor side effects. No side effects but noticed this week that I get a twinge of a palpiation ( I also have vent. tachycardia) BP is normal though. I have been on Bystolic for over 2 years after having a terrible time on Toprol.  Bystolic was a dream for 2 years and was very effective.  Suddenly, I am having severe headaches, nausea, dizziness, and difficulty breathing.  After having a wonderful 2 years I think I have to change meds now.

it has killed all sexual drive and desires and should be taken off the market.  I know nothing will happen to the manufacturers or the drs. that prescribe it but they at least need to make patients aware that that is a side affect and make it the pateints option whether they choose to take it.

New to me - changing to this was easy  and so far it is working great. No effects yet.

I'm down to 2.5 mg, and the numbers did tick upward, but now a more "normal" 120/75.  At this lower dosage though, I am much more susceptible to anxiety-induced spikes in BP & pulse. My doctor tried to tell me that my asthma like symptoms probably mean I have congestive heart failure. I DO NOT. The doctor and pharmaceutical companies will kill us all.

This has been so affective that my Dr took me completely off of my other bp med. This alone keeps my bp at 130/80 however......it is hard for me to get use to the hard heart beats and slower beat rate. Doesn't hurt or painful but, its just different and not sure if I want to continue with it at this time.

I have been dealing with an extraordinary amount of stress and found that all of a sudden, my heart was behaving in ways it never has before.  I stayed to my deadlines at work and took care of the families of family members who passed (7 in a 6 month period).  Finally, I went to the doctor and blood pressure was high.  She put me on Bystolic - 5 mg a day.  I have a calmer beating heart...however when stressers are hit, things still are present, but less intense.
Help to control hb and tachycardia. Been on this for 3years no problems. Was afraid to start it but so glad I did??

I HATE that i ever started using a beta blocker.  Yes, it did bring my bp down but the side effects are killing me!  It leaves me feeling tired and listless.  I don't feel like exercising but I've not lost any appetite so I've gained weight.  I'm having to take 80 meq of potassium cl/day, just to keep my potassium level in the safe range. I tried to quit once and after 2 days I started to experience chest pains, so now I feel like I'm trapped into continuing a medication that's harmful to me...and I only take 2.5 mg/day. I HATE IT!!!!!!

I've had a Great experience with this drug. 5 years ago while working out I had an Vertebral Artery Dissection which led to a Stroke. I totally blew out my left Vertebral Artery. A Mind Blowing Injury- Due to being in Excellent shape at the time I'm still alive today. My Doctor suggested this drug mentioning it would work well with my active lifestyle. Since taking Bystolic I have maintained healthy Blood pressure readings.
Got my bp under control but I am experiencing nausa lightheadedness and my pulse went from low 70 s to low 50s. Also experiencing confusion and memory problems.

I have been on this medication for well over a year now, every BP check has been 120/80.  Besides a lower energy level my potassium level dropped and had to start taking potassium pills.  Has anyone else on this med seen a drop in potassium level?

I have been taking Bystolic for about 4 years now. It has worked very well for me. leg cramps, and muscle pains..My eyes always appears to have floater or dirt in them. I keep yawning. when I am conversing with others and it appears that I am bored or uninterested in the conversation.

I was put on 20 mg after stroke. Keeps the bp down well, but have extreme dizziness. Tingling began early on, but blamed it on stroke. Turned to burning and stinging. Dizziness Weaning down 5mg per week. Now at 5mg? day. Let bp stabilize as other remedies catch up. Maybe I can get off this bad drug in another week or so. It has caused me to have low heart beat.

Some of the people who are leaving feedback must be the types that will find anything wrong with anything!  I have taken this drug for quite some time -- as with anything, you need to stick with it a while to get its full benefit.  I have always had high BP.  At 34 years old, I was diagnosed with acute hypogonadism, and I had to take eight pumps of the older version of Androgel, which is the highest dose available.  My normal bp medicine (hctz and licinopril) KILLED my sex drive and made it EXTREMELY difficult to keep a hard erection through to climax, and I had to take Viagra to get there.  After taking Bystolic for two to three weeks, it was like a magic cure.  I had erections again like I had when I was in my early 20s.  I am a HUGE believer in this drug, and one needs to stick with it to get the full benefit.  I did not experience with weight gain nor the sluggish feeling others on here blamed on Bystolic!  I can't wait for a generic form to come out, as it is quite expensive at the moment.  Luckily, I have a caring doctor, and I am surviving on Bystolic samples.

I have been taking Bystolic 10 mg every morning for the past three to four years for hypertension without bothersome side effects. The medication maintained my blood pressure pretty well even during a death of a close family member. The only issue I have is the cost of the medication through my prescription insurance but will continue taking it because it works and doesn't have any noticeable side effects.
Went from 5 mg to 2.5mg as higher dose made me very lethargic and dizzy. Now very satisfied.

have been on this pill about 3 years -have almost every side effect have seen after 150 reviews--went from 10 milagram per day to 2.5 after 1 week am starting to come back to life again-BP-STILL NORMAL-WILL TRY TO STOP SOON AND HOPE BP STAYS NORMAL
I have been taking 10mg Bystolic for 7 years for High Blood Pressure and an irregular heartbeat.  It's been very effective at regulating my heart beat and keeping my blood pressure under control.

I was put on this medication after a year of moderately high diastolic pressures with a sudden surge in BP to 200 /140. I felt immediate relief of at least three years of extreme fatigue.  My BP dropped to normal for the first time in probably ten years.  I had energy, felt alive again. I stopped putting on weight for no reason. I take 5 mg in the a.m. And 5 mg at night.  No fatigue, no side effects.  It's a little hard to get my heart rate in the top range when I'm working out, but stopped gaining weight and I can work out again!  Been on it for more than 4 months - so far, so good...

This is my second time on Bystolic. The second time around I went from 2.5 mg to 5.0 mg.  The doubling of dose was due to my increased hypertension. At 5.0 I noticed a dramatic increase in extreme tiredness and dizziness.  I lost motivation to get my daily chores done.  The increase in dose really did not help decrease my high blood pressure either!  I gained 5 pounds right away and have been unable to drop any weight even with extended water fasts of 3 days.  I did more research on other natural paths of controlling my BP and discovered the miracles of Magnesium.  After just 3 days my BP went from 140-150 (systolic) to now 120-135.  Diastolic numbers greatly improved too.  I halved my bystolic down to 2.5 and have maintained 120/80 range.  My goal is to increase my stores of magnesium with time and hopefully kick the bystolic.  Bystolic does help with mood swings (menapause) and anxiety to some extent. Overall my low dose is tolerable.  Some headaches and heavy legs due to water retention has also been experienced. These side effects are tolerable.

The best beta blocker (possibly the best HBP medication) due to it's antioxidant properties, increase in nitric oxide and improvement of artery function. It also has great heart rate control. This is one of the few drugs that can be taken alone without adding other medications. It seems to cover all bases and has a great safety profile.Side effects (if any) are minimal compared to other drug classes and lessen over time. My blood pressure, (occasional spikes) EKG's and lab numbers have been fine for almost 9 years. In my opinion, it's one of the better HBP medications. So far so good.
My blood pressure has been in control since I began using the med. I have noticed no adverse side affects.

This medication was prescribed for hypertension but I am concerned about the headaches since I'm not one prone to them there has also been a small amount of muscle cramping in the calves.The drug works well but I would stay in close contact with my physician and my pharmacist.
Take 80mg twice daily-could not tolerate the 160mg at one time.

It has slowly lowered my blood pressure. I also used to get head aches, but when you take diovan, you have to drink a LOT of water or you will have head aches. It helps to drink stuff like gatorade or vitamin water or other fluids containing potassium to get rid of leg/muscle cramps, in spite of what it says on the "drug interactions" part.
since I started taking it I have had a severe headache. my eyes and the top of my head hurt severly please help.

59 year old caucasian with 10 year history of HTN. Was on 2.5 mg of Vasotec, but it stopped working three months ago (a lot to stress). MD put me on 320 mg of Diovan ... all hell broke loose: severe abdominal cramping; felt like I was getting an ulcer with gastic burning; explosive and watery stools; extreme fatigue; weak as a kitten (I was an Olympic lifter in my youth and am still very strong ... before Diovan); chest congestion; very runny nose; cannot make sense of a simple newspaper article (I have five graduate degrees); very cold extremities; and memory dysfunction. MD told me there would be no side effects! I hate this stuff! I will cut my dose to 80mg for the next week. I'd rather have the HTN. Be very cautious with this stuff (Diovan).

I have been on Diovan for apprx 6mths (chngd from Lisinopril-bad cough)and have experienced chronic reflux issues, extreme hairloss and thinning, weight gain (very active 39 yr old female slightly overweight)joint pain, (knees creek and crack) slight libido change,but overall, BP has stabilized. Following CABG-5 surgery I was put on Lotensin 40mg/Coreg 12.5mg bid along with a couple other meds for other non-related conditions. I was discharged 6 days after surgery, full recovery within 10 days, bp remained steady at 140/80 consistantly for two years. My Family Practice MD changed the Lotensin to Diovan 7 months ago. My bp is all over the place, cannot keep anything on down, have lost almost 75 lbs, cannot stand, have developed Orthostatic Hypotension (bp drops upon standing) so bad that I have fallen twice requiring sutures/stapes, several other times not as serious. The change was due to post-nasal drip. Now the problem has become critical, but nobody believes that the symptoms started 7-10 days after starting the Diovan. I have never suffered from stomach cramps this bad in my life, even with diverticulosis/litis. I know this is the problem, but I cannot get my MD to agree. I have not been able to hold anything on my stomach for longer than 20-30 mins after eating, even water. My feet look like they're going to explode! I'm going to the ER in the morning to have staples removed and my Family MD told me not to sign the d/c papers and insist that I be admitted for further testing and he will be involved.

I took this drug for 3 or 4 years.  It lowered my blood pressure pretty well but I had to increase the dosage to 80 mcg (I'm very sensitive to drugs) about a year ago.  I gradually started to feel worse and worse, with my back aching and soon my joints and muscles.  I couldn't exercise without 3 days of really sharply sore muscles.  I told my doctor about the sore back and joints and muscles and was told that "It's part of getting old".  But it wasn't.  I finally pulled/tore a ligament and muscle in my shoulder and needed Physical Therapy.  Through all of these sore backs and joints and muscles, I was taking Ibuprofen just to function in my daily life.  My doctor ran my blood tests and my liver function tests were bad.  Bad enough that she took me off of Diovan.  It was like a weight was lifted from my shoulders--within 2 days I could get out of bed without hobbling when I started to walk.  My back started to feel better. My shoulder began to heal.  I could exercise and not be sore for 3 days. I don't need Ibuprofen anymore. My normal energy level has returned. And my liver function tests are getting better.  
   I should have insisted that my doctor take me seriously when I told her my muscles and joints and back hurt and that the hurt was different from sore muscles, much sharper.  Plus, what good is a drug if you need an NSAIDS to tolerate it's effect on your body.  Hopefully my liver is not permanently damaged!

I forgot to mention something. In addition to improved diet and walking every day, I have been drinking apple cider vinegar in a glass of water once or twice a day. I can't say this has helped normalize my BP without meds, but I don't know that it hasn't. There are numerous websites describing the health benefits of ACV. Check for yourself. If you decide to try it, stir one or two tablespoons of raw organic unfiltered apple cider vinegar with "mother" into a full glass of water. (Mother is the name for the little cobwebby nutrients that float in the vinegar.) Bragg is a good brand. So is Hain. If you don't like the vinegar taste, stir in a little honey. I first started doing this to help my irritable bowel but it has the rep for controlling BP as well. Be patient and give it a few weeks; nothing will happen overnight.

I posted on 7/21 about getting off Diovan.  I had to do something because the drug was causing unacceptable levels of bowel looseness plus a number of other annoying side effects. I was amazed at how easy it was to normalize my BP by becoming more active and improving my diet. The most important thing I can say here is get off your rear and get moving! Walking is ideal because it is gentle and works almost all your muscles. Start out slow and build up gradually. Start your new program several weeks before attempting to reduce your meds, and then talk to your doc first.

I stopped taking Diovan about a week ago. Several weeks prior to that, I started walking about a mile a day, every single day, half in the a.m.and half in the p.m. I walk fast enough to be out of breath when I get home. I also improved my diet. More fish & seafood, whole grains, more fruits & vegies, almost no sweets. I feel better than I have in several years with a lot more energy. Saw the doc today for a followup after quitting Diovan. My BP was 124/82 WITHOUT any meds at all. So tonight I celebrate. Bottom line, be sure you really need those drugs.

As we get older, our bodies suffer more and more irreparable damage from the environment.  You need to find out what is causing your BP to go up and fix it--not gloss over and chemically medicate it.  The American Heart Association is lying on it's website when they claim "no one knows why a person has high blood pressure." There are tons of studies out there on natural substances and fixing your diet (no sugar, low carb)to lower your BP, the better your blood sugar is, the better your blood pressure will be, in general. Before anyone takes this drug, they should have a blood test for their ANA level to see if they have an autoimmune disorder.  In 2006, I had NO health issues, but I went to have a mole removed.  I was nervous and had a huge amount of caffeine (coffee and soda) during the day.  So when I got to the Dr. office in the afternoon my blood pressure was really high which I have since learned was because of the caffeine.  Anyway, she put me on Diovan which was new in 2006.  Within a month I started having swelling and pain in my joints.  My knees & ankles hurt and my hands were really swollen and painful.  My daughter told me these sounded like symptoms of Lupus which my dad was diagnosed with when he died in 1993.  When I mentioned this to the doc, she ran a blood test and my ANA was sky-high so I was diagnosed with Lupus and sent to a Rheumatolgist.  Fact is that even though my ANA may have been high, I had NO symptoms of Lupus until I took the Diovan.  I believe it triggered my Lupus symtoms.  I'm no longer on Diovan but now I take Plaquenil for Lupus. The Lupus symtoms didn't subside when I quit taking the Diovan.  Sure wish I had refused the blood pressure med back in 2006.

Three days later the fog is gone and the ankle achs were gone, Did double up on my toprol, No side effects yet. Still have the lumps, Will have to have them cut out.

I began taking Diovan 40mg 12.5 mg. hctz about 18 months ago. It controlled my bp well and seemed to have few side effects.  About 6 months ago I began having bouts of all over joint pain usually for short intervals. EVERY joint in my body would ache. Three weeks ago the pain became non stop and the intensity was unbearable.  I was tested for RA and Lupus, negative result.  My internist informally diagnosed with Fibromyalgia and recommend a rheumatologist if pain did not improve. At my regular cardio appt. I described my symptoms to him, he immediately took me off the drug to see if it would help.  6 days after discontinuing the meds I was virtually pain free and remain so another  week later. If you are diagnosed with fibro or suffer any of these symptoms after beginning the med find a doctor who willhelp you get off this and onto something else while you determine if your symptoms improve. I was on the lowest dose, so was able to stop immediately although this may not be recommended for higher dosages.

I take this drug for high BP and mitral valve prolapse syndrome. I started taking the medication when I was 26. I am now 41 and it still works great. I take the medication at the same time everyday and if there is a day that I am only an hour behind, my heart lets me know. I took this med when I was pregnant with my 2nd child at the age of 30. I had no side effects and the baby was fine. The only downside was breastfeeding. I couldn't breast feed her because the medication made her heart rate drop. I found this out before I left the hospital. Everytime I would breast feed her and the hospital staff would take her vitals her heart rate would be abnormally low. This didn't happen when she was given formula.
I have never had any side effects from this medicine and my bp is always been within the proper range.

I've been on 50mg of Atenolol for about a month and a half.  Lowered my BP from 150-170's/80-90's, to 110-130's/60-70's.  Also lowered my resting heart rate from 90-110's to 60-70's.  I also had irregular/rapid heart rate on occasion and this seems to occur much less sense I've been on this med.  I'm a prostate cancer survivor, so it's hard to say about the side effects of this med, because some of the side effects are the same as the ones I've had because of my cancer and treatment for that (surgery).  But most noticeable have been diarrhea, fatigue, dizziness when getting up to fast, frequent urination and ED.  All but the dizziness I had before with the prostate cancer, this drug just made them worse.  But it has worked as advertised and I'm willing to put up with the side effects to get my BP and heart rate lower.
Treatment for high blood pressure.  Very effective, takes medicine at bedtime, sometimes makes me sleepy during the day.

Also have notice hair thinning within the past 2 months.  Just started to notice tinggleing in the finger tips.  Time to get to thr DR. office and try something else!  Very effective at lowering my BP and heart rate but quality of life has been lowered also.

I was put on atenolol last year,I started having severe anxiety,could feel my heart beating in my ears,felt like every nerve in my body was coming out.Lost 35 lbs.,everyone thought I was having a nervous breakdown,I tried to tell my MD it was the med.No one believed me.I had to double up for two weeks and only God knows what I went through those two weeks .I only slept two hrs. a night,the two months I was on it.I don't know if anyone else has ever gone through this,but I found out later,that my daddy couldn't take a Beta Blocker.I was only on 25mg.a day.I finally got off it and got my life back,I know I would have died if I had stayed on this med.The first few days I was on it,I felt like I had a hot iron on my chest,my heart pounding in my head,and the severe anxiety was unbearable.All I did was walk the floor,I couldn't sit down because I was so nervous.When I got off of it I was so thankful,people saw that it had been the med.I would actually feel my whole body shaking inside,but know one could see what I was feeling.I still have some trembling in my legs when I lay down,but I hope,but don't think that will ever go away.I 've been off it for over a year now.I was only on it two months.Has anyone else ever had this reaction to this med? My husband has been on it for 25 years and it's worked for him.I don't think I will ever try another Beta Blocker.My B/p has been low but just recently it has spiked so now I've been on Bebecar for three weeks,so far,no problems,except the usual,ringing in ears,headache now and then.But no anxiety thank goodness.I do know atenolol is not for me ever again.

Get blood tests 4x yr in 1st year.  Phone in any side effects/BD changes to MD. SPEAK UP FOR YOURSELF!  MD is busy but they have med. techs who can help you.  If the MD ignores you find another MD and tell the first one why you leaving and march in and demand all your records for your new MD.  See if they have a Web site and perhaps you can enter a complaint. Actually, I have found that as age my MD finds my "take charge of yourself" mindset refreshing.  She does not have to keep "fishing around" for the info she needs!  Come prepared, write down all your concerns/questions, if you are very ill, try to keep a daily log or do the best you can to provide all possible information when you get to see your Doctor.

I started taking Atenolol 2005; 
It did a very good job at lowering my blood pressure.
After taking Atenolol (10mg) daily for approximately three years the side affects started.
I was unable to function at all three or four days a week.
The doctors where unable to determined what was causing my severe dizziness and lightheadedness.
This was after numerous X-Rays, Cat Scans and MRI’s
After almost two years of suffering, I decided to quit all of my Vitamins and supplemental; I take about twenty a day.
As a last resort I found another Doctor and had him find another blood pressure medication.
I’m now taking Amlodipine (10mg) daily.
It seems to be working somewhat, my BP is still much high.
After coming off the Atenolol over a thirty day period about 80% of the side affects are gone, thank the Lord for small favors.
Be very careful with all of the so called FDA approved blood pressure drugs.
I only wish a few more “Medical Doctors” would read some of reviews that real people write.

I went to the hospital because I was having a hard pounding in my chest every five minutes or so. They asked me how long I had high blood pressure, and I said I didn't know I had it. They gave me the medication and said I was having heart pulputions or something like that. Well, I thought it was a panic attack for losing a $2000.00 check that I never lost. (Later found it at home)Well, they don't tell you once you start taking it that you can't just stop taking it or it can damage your heart. So, I took it for like 2 years and was experiencing soreness in my legs to where I couldn't walk and felt ill all the time, so, my doctor made me take a higher dose, and the symptoms got worse. I told her about the soreness in my muscles and she said it was from working too hard. Then she left her place of work and got her own practice but didn't take all of her patients that she was treating I guess. Anyway I went and got a three months supply and started taking 3 quarters of it for like 6 weeks then went to half for 6 weeks then to a quater for six weeks and then stopped. It's been almosts 2 years now and haven't had any problems with the muscle in my legs and check my bllod pressure regulary and it's been normal. Just wanted to sharethat little story for those who might be experiencing the same things. Get check out by a good doctor, not one who just wants the paycheck and one who care about thier patient.
